• 사람이 - "person (subject)" - 사람 (person) + 이 (subject particle)
• F였으면 - "if they were F type" - F (Feeling type) + 이다 (to be) + 었으면 (if/conditional)
Grammar Deep Dive: "준비해 온 사람" refers to someone who prepared and brought games (likely themselves). "F였으면" hypothesizes about Feeling personality types. This sets up a contrasting scenario about how F types would react differently to social rejection compared to T (Thinking) types.
Sentence 7
그 사람 상처받고 밤에 울 수도 있겠네 어 맞아요 그렇겠지 그렇겠지
"That person might get hurt and cry at night. Oh, that's right, it would be like that, it would be like that"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그 사람 - "that person" - Demonstrative + person
• 상처받고 - "get hurt and" - 상처받다 (to be hurt/wounded) + 고 (and)
• 밤에 - "at night" - 밤 (night) + 에 (time particle)
• 울 수도 있겠네 - "might cry" - 울다 (to cry) + ㄹ 수도 있다 (might) + 겠네 (realization)
• 어 - "oh" - Interjection of realization
• 맞아요 - "that's right" - 맞다 (to be correct) + polite
• 그렇겠지 - "it would be like that" - 그렇다 (to be so) + 겠지 (presumption)
• 그렇겠지 - Repeated for emphasis
Grammar Deep Dive: "상처받고 밤에 울 수도 있겠네" predicts emotional vulnerability of F types. "울 수도 있겠네" combines possibility (ㄹ 수도 있다) with realization (겠네). The repetition "그렇겠지 그렇겠지" shows agreement and confirmation. This demonstrates understanding of how Feeling types process social rejection emotionally.
Sentence 8
제가 아주 전략적이게도
"Very strategically, I"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 제가 - "I" - Humble first person + subject particle
• 아주 - "very/quite" - Intensifying adverb
• 전략적이게도 - "strategically" - 전략적이다 (to be strategic) + 게 (adverb) + 도 (even/also)
Grammar Deep Dive: "아주 전략적이게도" emphasizes their strategic approach with 아주 (very) and 도 (even). This phrase sets up revelation of their strategic solution. The sentence appears to be continuing to explain their systematic approach to potential social problems.
Sentence 1
제가 잘하는 것만 들고 왔어요 못하는 거 안 들고왔어 이길려고 하나
"I only brought what I'm good at. I didn't bring things I'm bad at. Am I trying to win?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 제가 - "I" - Humble first person + subject particle
• 잘하는 - "good at" - 잘하다 (to do well) + 는 (modifier)
• 것만 - "only things" - 것 (things) + 만 (only)
• 들고 왔어요 - "brought" - 들고 오다 (to bring/carry) + past polite
• 못하는 - "bad at" - 못하다 (to be bad at) + 는 (modifier)
• 거 - "things" - 것 (things) shortened
• 안 들고왔어 - "didn't bring" - 안 (not) + 들고 오다 (bring) + past casual
• 이길려고 하나 - "am I trying to win?" - 이기다 (to win) + 려고 하다 (trying to) + 나 (question)
Grammar Deep Dive: "잘하는 것만" emphasizes selective choice using 만 (only). "못하는 거 안 들고왔어" shows strategic omission. "이길려고 하나" is a self-questioning about competitive motives using 나 ending. This reveals strategic thinking about competitive advantage through careful game selection.
Sentence 2
저희 뭔가 E방 Extraversion : 외향형
"We something... E room Extraversion: Extroverted type"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 저희 - "we" - Humble form of 우리 (we)
• 뭔가 - "something" - 무엇인가 (something) contracted
• E방 - "E room" - Extrovert room designation
• Extraversion - English psychology term
• 외향형 - "extroverted type" - 외향 (outward-facing) + 형 (type)
Grammar Deep Dive: This appears to be an incomplete thought ("저희 뭔가") that trails off, suggesting the speaker was about to suggest something for the group but got interrupted or changed direction. The E room designation indicates this is from an extrovert participant.
Sentence 3
생활규칙 같은 거 정해놓으면 좋을 것 같은데
"It seems like it would be good if we established living rules or something like that"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 생활규칙 - "living rules" - 생활 (living/lifestyle) + 규칙 (rules)
• 같은 거 - "something like" - 같은 (like/similar) + 거 (thing)
• 정해놓으면 - "if we establish/decide" - 정해놓다 (to decide/establish) + 면 (if/when)
• 좋을 것 같은데 - "it seems like it would be good" - 좋다 (good) + ㄹ 것 같다 (seems like) + 는데 (background)
Grammar Deep Dive: "정해놓으면 좋을 것 같은데" suggests establishing rules in advance for communal benefit. "같은 거" softens the suggestion by making it less specific. "는데" provides background information while inviting response. This shows typical extrovert organizing behavior and group structure consideration.
Sentence 4
E방 Extraversion : 외향형 와 역시 좋죠~ 생활규칙을 정할까요? 역시 J 군
"E room Extraversion: Extroverted type. Wow, as expected, that's good~ Shall we establish living rules? As expected, J type"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• E방 - "E room" - Extrovert room designation
• Extraversion - English psychology term
• 외향형 - "extroverted type" - 외향 (outward-facing) + 형 (type)
• 와 - "wow" - Exclamation of amazement
• 역시 - "as expected/indeed" - Adverb confirming expectations
• 좋죠~ - "that's good~" - 좋다 (good) + 죠 (confirmatory) + elongated tone
• 생활규칙을 - "living rules (object)" - 생활규칙 (living rules) + 을 (object particle)
• 정할까요? - "shall we establish?" - 정하다 (to decide/establish) + ㄹ까요 (shall we)
• 역시 - "as expected" - Repeated for emphasis
• J 군 - "J type (person)" - J (Judging type) + 군 (person, casual)
Grammar Deep Dive: "와 역시 좋죠~" shows enthusiastic agreement. "정할까요?" makes a group suggestion using polite form. "역시 J 군" identifies the organizer as a J (Judging) type, showing MBTI awareness. The repeated "역시" emphasizes that this organizing behavior matches expectations for J types.
Sentence 5
근데 또 못 지킬 거 말고 진짜 지킬 수 있는 거 그리고 또 지켜야 되는 거
"But not things we can't keep, but things we can really keep. And also things we need to keep"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 근데 - "but/however" - Casual connector
• 또 - "also/again" - Additive particle
• 못 지킬 - "can't keep" - 못 (cannot) + 지키다 (to keep/follow)
• 거 - "things" - 것 (things) shortened
• 말고 - "not/instead of" - Negative selection particle
• 진짜 - "really" - Intensifier meaning truly
• 지킬 수 있는 - "can keep" - 지키다 (to keep) + ㄹ 수 있다 (can) + 는 (modifier)
• 거 - "things" - 것 (things) shortened
• 그리고 - "and" - Connector
• 또 - "also" - Additive particle
• 지켜야 되는 - "need to keep" - 지키다 (keep) + 야 되다 (must/need) + 는 (modifier)
• 거 - "things" - 것 (things) shortened
Grammar Deep Dive: "못 지킬 거 말고" excludes unrealistic rules. "진짜 지킬 수 있는 거" emphasizes realistic expectations. "지켜야 되는 거" adds necessity criteria. This shows practical thinking about rule-making - distinguishing between aspirational, achievable, and necessary rules.
Sentence 6
그러면! 여기 네임펜 있어요
"Then! There's a name pen here"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그러면! - "then!" - Logical connector with excitement
• 여기 - "here" - Location demonstrative
• 네임펜 - "name pen" - From English "name pen" (marker)
• 있어요 - "there is" - 있다 (to exist) + polite ending
Grammar Deep Dive: "그러면!" shows enthusiastic transition to action. Finding a "네임펜" (marker/name pen) indicates immediate preparation for writing down rules. This demonstrates typical extrovert behavior of moving quickly from idea to implementation.
Sentence 7
저 볼펜 갖고 올게요 제가 쓸게요 네 불러주세요!
"I'll go get a ballpoint pen. I'll write. Yes, please call me!"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 저 - "I" - Humble first person
• 볼펜 - "ballpoint pen" - From English "ball pen"
• 갖고 올게요 - "I'll bring" - 갖고 오다 (to bring/fetch) + ㄹ게요 (intention)
• 제가 - "I" - Humble first person + subject particle
• 쓸게요 - "I'll write" - 쓰다 (to write) + ㄹ게요 (intention)
• 네 - "yes" - Polite acknowledgment
• 불러주세요! - "please call me!" - 불러주다 (to call for someone) + 세요 (polite request)
Grammar Deep Dive: Multiple volunteers showing extrovert enthusiasm for participating. "갖고 올게요" and "쓸게요" both use 게요 ending showing willingness to contribute. "불러주세요" requests inclusion in the process. This shows typical extrovert eagerness to be involved in group activities.
Sentence 8
그러면~ 어떻게 뭐 지켜야 되는 규칙 있으실까요? 뭐가 있을까요?
"Then~ how, what rules do you think we need to follow? What might there be?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그러면~ - "then~" - Logical connector with elongated, facilitating tone
• 어떻게 - "how" - Question word for method
• 뭐 - "what" - Question word
• 지켜야 되는 - "need to follow" - 지키다 (to keep/follow) + 야 되다 (must) + 는 (modifier)
• 규칙 - "rules" - Rules/regulations
• 있으실까요? - "do you think there are?" - 있다 (to exist) + 으시 (honorific) + ㄹ까요 (polite questioning)
• 뭐가 - "what (subject)" - 뭐 (what) + 가 (subject particle)
• 있을까요? - "might there be?" - 있다 (to exist) + ㄹ까요 (wondering/questioning)
Grammar Deep Dive: "있으실까요?" uses honorific form to respectfully ask for input. The double questioning "뭐가 있을까요?" encourages brainstorming. This shows facilitative leadership style - setting up the process but seeking group input rather than dictating rules.
Sentence 9
잘 때 말 걸지 마라 이런 거?
"Don't talk to me when sleeping, something like that?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 잘 때 - "when sleeping" - 자다 (to sleep) + ㄹ 때 (when/time of)
• 말 - "words/talking" - Speech/conversation
• 걸지 마라 - "don't talk to" - 걸다 (to talk to/address) + 지 마라 (don't do)
• 이런 거? - "something like this?" - 이런 (like this) + 거 (thing) + question
Grammar Deep Dive: "잘 때 말 걸지 마라" suggests a basic boundary rule using imperative form. "이런 거?" seeks validation of this type of rule suggestion. This provides a concrete example to get the brainstorming started, showing practical understanding of communal living needs.
Sentence 1
잘 때 말 걸지 마라 그냥 알아서 잘 하면 되지 않아요? 알잘딱깔센
"Don't talk when sleeping. Can't we just do well on our own? Use your good judgment"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 잘 때 - "when sleeping" - 자다 (to sleep) + ㄹ 때 (when/time of)
• 말 걸지 마라 - "don't talk" - 말 걸다 (to talk to/address) + 지 마라 (don't do)
• 그냥 - "just" - Adverb meaning simply/just
• 알아서 - "on one's own/by oneself" - 알다 (to know) + 아서 (and/by)
• 잘 - "well" - Adverb meaning well/properly
• 하면 - "if we do" - 하다 (to do) + 면 (if/when)
• 되지 않아요? - "wouldn't it work?" - 되다 (to work/become) + 지 않다 (not) + question
• 알잘딱깔센 - Modern internet slang acronym meaning "use your good judgment"
Grammar Deep Dive: "알아서 잘 하면 되지 않아요?" suggests self-regulation over formal rules. "알잘딱깔센" is internet slang standing for "알아서 잘 딱 깔끔하게 센스있게" (figure it out well, neatly, and with good sense). This shows preference for informal, trust-based community management rather than rigid rule structures.
Sentence 2
뭐 설거지 같은 거?
"What about dishwashing and such things?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 뭐 - "what/well" - Question word or filler
• 설거지 - "dishwashing" - 설거지하다 (to wash dishes) noun form
• 같은 거? - "things like that?" - 같은 (like/similar) + 거 (thing) + question
Grammar Deep Dive: "설거지 같은 거?" suggests practical household tasks that might need organizing. "같은 거" implies there are other similar chores to consider. This shifts the conversation from abstract rules to concrete household management needs.
Sentence 3
좋다 당번? 설거지 당번 이런 거 좋은 것 같다
"Good. Duty rotation? Dishwashing duty, things like this seem good"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 좋다 - "good" - Adjective expressing approval
• 당번? - "duty rotation?" - System of taking turns for responsibilities
• 설거지 - "dishwashing" - Washing dishes
• 당번 - "duty/rotation" - Taking turns system
• 이런 거 - "things like this" - 이런 (like this) + 거 (thing)
• 좋은 것 같다 - "seems good" - 좋다 (good) + 것 같다 (seems like)
Grammar Deep Dive: "당번" is a Korean concept of rotating responsibilities common in schools and workplaces. "설거지 당번 이런 거 좋은 것 같다" shows agreement with structured task rotation. This demonstrates Korean cultural familiarity with organized duty systems for group management.
Sentence 4
게임해갖고 끼니 때마다 한 명씩 이렇게 돌아가면서
"Play a game and then one person each mealtime, rotating like this"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 게임해갖고 - "play a game and" - 게임하다 (to play game) + 가지고 (and then)
• 끼니 - "meal" - Meal/mealtime
• 때마다 - "every time" - 때 (time) + 마다 (every/each)
• 한 명씩 - "one person each" - 한 명 (one person) + 씩 (each/respectively)
• 이렇게 - "like this" - Demonstrative adverb
• 돌아가면서 - "while rotating" - 돌아가다 (to rotate/take turns) + 면서 (while)
Grammar Deep Dive: "게임해갖고" suggests using games to determine assignments. "끼니 때마다 한 명씩 돌아가면서" creates a systematic rotation schedule tied to mealtimes. This combines fun (games) with practical organization, showing creative approach to household management.
Sentence 5
게임이 빠지질 않네요 설거지는 어떻게 할까요?
"Games never get left out. How should we handle dishwashing?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 게임이 - "games (subject)" - 게임 (game) + 이 (subject particle)
• 빠지질 않네요 - "don't get left out" - 빠지다 (to be omitted/left out) + 질 않다 (won't) + 네요 (observation)
• 설거지는 - "dishwashing (topic)" - 설거지 (dishwashing) + 는 (topic particle)
• 어떻게 - "how" - Question word for method
• 할까요? - "shall we do?" - 하다 (to do) + ㄹ까요 (shall we/wondering)
Grammar Deep Dive: "게임이 빠지질 않네요" observes that games are always included in their planning. "설거지는 어떻게 할까요?" shifts focus to specific practical concerns. This shows the group's tendency to integrate fun with necessary tasks while addressing practical needs.
Sentence 6
저희가 4일 동안 있잖아요
"We're here for 4 days, you know"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 저희가 - "we (subject)" - 저희 (humble we) + 가 (subject particle)
• 4일 - "4 days" - Number + 일 (day)
• 동안 - "during/for" - Duration particle
• 있잖아요 - "we are, you know" - 있다 (to be/exist) + 잖아요 (explanatory, obvious)
Grammar Deep Dive: "있잖아요" uses explanatory ending to reference shared knowledge - they all know the duration. This establishes the timeframe for planning purposes, providing context for how to organize duties and responsibilities.
Sentence 7
그러니까 4일 동안 있으니까 근데 저희 밥도 이따가 계속 해 먹어야 돼요 저희가 밥도
"So since we're here for 4 days, but we also need to keep cooking and eating meals later, we also need to cook"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그러니까 - "so/therefore" - Logical connector
• 4일 동안 - "for 4 days" - Duration expression
• 있으니까 - "since we are" - 있다 (to be) + 으니까 (since/because)
• 근데 - "but/however" - Casual connector
• 저희 - "we" - Humble form
• 밥도 - "meals too" - 밥 (rice/meal) + 도 (also/too)
• 이따가 - "later" - Time expression for later today
• 계속 - "continuously" - Adverb meaning continuously
• 해 먹어야 돼요 - "need to cook and eat" - 해 먹다 (to cook and eat) + 야 되다 (must/need)
• 저희가 - "we (subject)" - 저희 (humble we) + 가 (subject)
• 밥도 - "meals too" - Repeated for emphasis
Grammar Deep Dive: "4일 동안 있으니까" provides causal reasoning. "해 먹어야 돼요" combines cooking and eating in one compound verb showing the full meal process. The repetition "저희가 밥도" emphasizes meal preparation as an additional responsibility beyond other activities.
Sentence 8
어 혹시 요리 하실 줄 아는 분 호텔조리과요
"Oh, anyone who knows how to cook by any chance? Hotel culinary arts major"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 어 - "oh" - Interjection showing realization
• 혹시 - "by any chance/perhaps" - Adverb for polite inquiry
• 요리 - "cooking" - Culinary preparation
• 하실 줄 아는 - "knows how to do" - 하다 (to do) + 시 (honorific) + ㄹ 줄 알다 (to know how to)
• 분 - "person" - Polite counter for people
• 호텔조리과요 - "hotel culinary arts major" - Academic department + polite ending
Grammar Deep Dive: "하실 줄 아는 분" uses honorific form with ability expression to politely inquire about cooking skills. "호텔조리과요" reveals someone has professional culinary training. This shows practical approach to task assignment based on actual skills and qualifications.
Sentence 1
난 콘푸로스트 마스터야 우유의 적정량과 그 바삭함 굉장히 진짜 나는
"I'm a cornflakes master. The proper amount of milk and that crunchiness, really tremendously, I really"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 난 - "I" - Casual contraction of 나는 (I + topic)
• 콘푸로스트 - "cornflakes" - Korean pronunciation of "cornflakes"
• 마스터야 - "am a master" - Master + 야 (casual copula)
• 우유의 - "milk's" - 우유 (milk) + 의 (possessive particle)
• 적정량과 - "proper amount and" - 적정량 (appropriate amount) + 과 (and)
• 그 - "that" - Demonstrative
• 바삭함 - "crunchiness" - 바삭하다 (to be crispy) + ㅁ (nominalizer)
• 굉장히 - "tremendously" - Intensifying adverb
• 진짜 - "really" - Intensifier meaning truly
• 나는 - "I" - First person pronoun + topic particle
Grammar Deep Dive: "콘푸로스트 마스터야" claims expertise in a very specific, humble domain. "우유의 적정량과 그 바삭함" shows technical knowledge about cereal preparation. The sentence trails off with "굉장히 진짜 나는" suggesting they're building up to an impressive claim about their skills.
Sentence 2
그 누구한테 입에 떠 넣어줘도 움~ 소리가 나오게 할 수 있을 정도로
"To the extent that I can make anyone go 'mmm~' when I feed them a spoonful"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그 누구한테 - "to anyone" - 그 누구 (anyone) + 한테 (to person)
• 입에 - "in the mouth" - 입 (mouth) + 에 (location particle)
• 떠 넣어줘도 - "even if I feed" - 떠 넣어주다 (to feed/spoon-feed) + 어도 (even if)
• 움~ - "mmm~" - Onomatopoeia for satisfaction/pleasure
• 소리가 - "sound (subject)" - 소리 (sound) + 가 (subject particle)
• 나오게 - "come out" - 나오다 (to come out) + 게 (manner/result)
• 할 수 있을 - "can make" - 하다 (to do/make) + ㄹ 수 있다 (can) + ㄹ (modifier)
• 정도로 - "to the extent that" - 정도 (degree/extent) + 로 (to/by)
Grammar Deep Dive: "그 누구한테 입에 떠 넣어줘도" creates a universal scenario - feeding anyone. "움~ 소리가 나오게 할 수 있을 정도로" expresses their confidence in producing satisfaction sounds. This is a humorous and confident claim about their cereal-making expertise, using detailed sensory language.
Sentence 3
이제 보드게임이나 해야 되겠네요 바로?
"Now we should probably play board games, right?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 이제 - "now" - Temporal marker for transition
• 보드게임이나 - "board games or something" - 보드게임 (board games) + 이나 (or/at least)
• 해야 되겠네요 - "should probably do" - 하다 (to do) + 야 되다 (should) + 겠네요 (probably/seems like)
• 바로? - "right?" - Immediately/right + question intonation
Grammar Deep Dive: "이제" signals topic transition from cooking to games. "보드게임이나" uses 이나 to suggest board games as an option among others. "해야 되겠네요" combines obligation (해야 되다) with probability (겠네요), making a gentle suggestion. "바로?" seeks immediate confirmation.
Sentence 4
네? 일단 해 봐 거절을 안 했으면 일단 해
"Yes? Just try it first. If they didn't refuse, just do it"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 네? - "yes?" - Polite response with questioning tone
• 일단 - "first/for now" - Adverb meaning temporarily or as first step
• 해 봐 - "try doing" - 하다 (to do) + 보다 (try) + casual imperative
• 거절을 - "refusal (object)" - 거절 (refusal/rejection) + 을 (object particle)
• 안 했으면 - "if they didn't do" - 안 하다 (not do) + 았으면 (if/conditional)
• 일단 - "just/for now" - Repeated for emphasis
• 해 - "do" - 하다 (to do) casual imperative
Grammar Deep Dive: "일단 해 봐" suggests trying without overthinking. "거절을 안 했으면 일단 해" creates a simple decision rule - absence of refusal equals consent to proceed. This shows practical approach to group participation - assuming willingness unless explicitly stated otherwise.
Sentence 5
누가 거절하면 멈추고 거절해도 괜찮아요? 상처 안 받아요?
"If someone refuses, we'll stop. Is it okay to refuse? You won't get hurt?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 누가 - "someone/who" - Question word + subject particle
• 거절하면 - "if they refuse" - 거절하다 (to refuse) + 면 (if/when)
• 멈추고 - "stop and" - 멈추다 (to stop) + 고 (and)
• 거절해도 - "even if you refuse" - 거절하다 (to refuse) + 어도 (even if)
• 괜찮아요? - "is it okay?" - 괜찮다 (to be okay) + polite question
• 상처 - "hurt/wound" - Emotional or physical injury
• 안 받아요? - "won't get?" - 안 받다 (not receive/get) + polite question
Grammar Deep Dive: "누가 거절하면 멈추고" establishes respectful boundaries. "거절해도 괜찮아요?" explicitly gives permission to decline. "상처 안 받아요?" shows concern for emotional impact of rejection. This demonstrates excellent group facilitation - making participation truly voluntary and safe.
Sentence 6
아 그럼요 상처 안 받아요
"Oh, of course. I won't get hurt"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아 - "oh" - Interjection expressing understanding
• 그럼요 - "of course" - Emphatic agreement
• 상처 - "hurt/wound" - Emotional injury
• 안 받아요 - "won't get/receive" - 안 받다 (not receive) + polite
Grammar Deep Dive: "아 그럼요" provides emphatic reassurance. "상처 안 받아요" directly addresses the emotional concern. This response shows emotional maturity and understanding of group dynamics - reassuring others that rejection won't cause personal offense.
Sentence 7
그럼 저는 일단 하는 거 볼래요 아 보시겠다? 괜찮네요 해보실래요?
"Then I'll watch what you're doing for now. Oh, you'll watch? That's fine. Would you like to try?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그럼 - "then" - Logical connector
• 저는 - "I" - Humble first person + topic particle
• 일단 - "for now/first" - Temporarily
• 하는 거 - "what you're doing" - 하다 (to do) + 는 거 (nominalizer)
• 볼래요 - "I'll watch" - 보다 (to watch) + ㄹ래요 (intention)
• 아 - "oh" - Interjection of realization
• 보시겠다? - "you'll watch?" - 보다 (to watch) + 시 (honorific) + 겠다 (intention) + question
• 괜찮네요 - "that's fine" - 괜찮다 (to be okay) + 네요 (gentle observation)
• 해보실래요? - "would you like to try?" - 해보다 (to try doing) + 시 (honorific) + ㄹ래요 (polite offer)
Grammar Deep Dive: "일단 하는 거 볼래요" chooses observer role initially. "보시겠다?" confirms others' watching intentions with honorific. "해보실래요?" makes polite invitation using honorific form. This shows graduated participation - watching first, then potentially joining.
Sentence 8
저도 볼래요
"I'll watch too"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 저도 - "I too" - 저 (humble I) + 도 (also/too)
• 볼래요 - "I'll watch" - 보다 (to watch) + ㄹ래요 (intention/want to)
Grammar Deep Dive: Simple agreement to join as observer using "도" (also/too). Shows others choosing the same gradual participation approach - watching before potentially playing.
Sentence 9
나 혼자 할 것 같은데? 나 혼자 하고 있는 거 다들
"It seems like I'll be playing alone? Everyone, I'm playing by myself"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 나 - "I" - Casual first person pronoun
• 혼자 - "alone" - By oneself
• 할 것 같은데? - "it seems like I'll do?" - 하다 (to do) + ㄹ 것 같다 (seems like) + 는데 (background/questioning)
• 나 - "I" - Repeated for emphasis
• 혼자 - "alone" - Repeated for emphasis
• 하고 있는 거 - "what I'm doing" - 하다 (to do) + 고 있다 (progressive) + 는 거 (nominalizer)
• 다들 - "everyone" - 다 (all) + 들 (plural marker)
Grammar Deep Dive: "할 것 같은데?" expresses resigned prediction with questioning tone. The repetition "나 혼자...나 혼자" emphasizes the isolation. "하고 있는 거 다들" addresses the group about their solo situation. This creates the exact scenario predicted earlier about playing alone to trigger ISFJ helping behavior.
Sentence 10
이 분이 같이 해줄 거예요 ISFJ님 거절 안 했구나
"This person will play with me. ISFJ, you didn't refuse"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 이 분이 - "this person (subject)" - 이 분 (this person, polite) + 이 (subject particle)
• 같이 - "together" - Adverb meaning together/with
• 해줄 거예요 - "will play with me" - 해주다 (to do for someone) + ㄹ 거예요 (future intention)
• ISFJ님 - "ISFJ" - MBTI type + 님 (honorific)
• 거절 - "refusal" - Rejection/declining
• 안 했구나 - "didn't do" - 안 하다 (not do) + 았구나 (realization ending)
Grammar Deep Dive: "이 분이 같이 해줄 거예요" predicts someone will join them. "ISFJ님 거절 안 했구나" identifies the personality type and notes they didn't refuse with 구나 (realization). This is the exact MBTI behavioral prediction coming true - ISFJ helping someone who appears to need company, validating the earlier strategic analysis.
Sentence 1
사보타지 같이 하실래요? 둘이서 하면 너무... 임포스터가 한 명이고 진행자가 한 명이라
"Would you like to play Sabotage together? If two people play, it's too... there's one impostor and one moderator"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 사보타지 - "Sabotage" - Board game name from English
• 같이 - "together" - Adverb meaning with/together
• 하실래요? - "would you like to play?" - 하다 (to do/play) + 시 (honorific) + ㄹ래요 (would you like to)
• 둘이서 - "two people" - 둘 (two) + 이서 (together)
• 하면 - "if we play" - 하다 (to do/play) + 면 (if/when)
• 너무... - "too..." - Intensifier trailing off (too obvious/simple)
• 임포스터가 - "impostor (subject)" - From English "impostor" + 가 (subject particle)
• 한 명이고 - "one person and" - 한 명 (one person) + 이고 (and/is and)
• 진행자가 - "moderator (subject)" - 진행자 (facilitator/moderator) + 가 (subject particle)
• 한 명이라 - "one person, so" - 한 명 (one person) + 이라 (is/being)
Grammar Deep Dive: "하실래요?" makes polite invitation using honorific. "둘이서 하면 너무..." suggests two-player games are too simple, trailing off. "임포스터가 한 명이고 진행자가 한 명이라" explains the game mechanics that make it predictable with only two players. This shows game expertise and consideration for optimal player counts.
Sentence 2
게임이 뻔하긴 한데 괜찮아 괜찮아 알려주세요
"The game is predictable, but it's okay, it's okay. Please let me know"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 게임이 - "game (subject)" - 게임 (game) + 이 (subject particle)
• 뻔하긴 한데 - "predictable though" - 뻔하다 (obvious/predictable) + 긴 하다 (though) + 는데 (but)
• 괜찮아 - "it's okay" - 괜찮다 (to be okay) casual form
• 괜찮아 - "it's okay" - Repeated for reassurance
• 알려주세요 - "please let me know" - 알려주다 (to inform for someone) + 세요 (polite request)
Grammar Deep Dive: "뻔하긴 한데" acknowledges the game's predictability while accepting it anyway using 긴 하다 structure. The repeated "괜찮아" shows reassurance despite the limitation. "알려주세요" requests communication about decisions. This shows flexibility and willingness to play despite suboptimal conditions.
Sentence 3
어 좋아요 같이 하실래요? 그럼 둘이 하세요
"Oh, good. Would you like to play together? Then you two play"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 어 - "oh" - Interjection showing realization or response
• 좋아요 - "good" - 좋다 (to be good) + polite ending
• 같이 - "together" - Adverb meaning with/together
• 하실래요? - "would you like to play?" - 하다 (to do/play) + 시 (honorific) + ㄹ래요 (would you like to)
• 그럼 - "then" - Logical connector
• 둘이 - "you two" - 둘 (two) + 이 (subject particle)
• 하세요 - "play" - 하다 (to do/play) + 세요 (polite imperative)
Grammar Deep Dive: "어 좋아요" shows positive response. "같이 하실래요?" continues polite invitations. "그럼 둘이 하세요" suggests organizing the players and stepping back from participation. This shows facilitating behavior - organizing others to play while potentially not joining themselves.
Sentence 4
아 네 한번 해볼게요 어 그럼 저 구경할게요 네?
"Ah, yes, I'll try it once. Oh, then I'll watch. Yes?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아 - "ah" - Interjection expressing decision
• 네 - "yes" - Polite agreement
• 한번 - "once" - One time/try
• 해볼게요 - "I'll try" - 해보다 (to try doing) + ㄹ게요 (intention)
• 어 - "oh" - Interjection showing change of mind
• 그럼 - "then" - Logical connector
• 저 - "I" - Humble first person
• 구경할게요 - "I'll watch" - 구경하다 (to watch/observe) + ㄹ게요 (intention)
• 네? - "yes?" - Seeking confirmation
Grammar Deep Dive: "한번 해볼게요" shows willingness to try. "어 그럼 저 구경할게요" shows quick change to observer role. The questioning "네?" seeks confirmation of their decision. This demonstrates the common pattern of initial willingness followed by stepping back to watching - typical introvert behavior.
Sentence 5
거절 잘하시네요~ 하시는 분 생겼으니까 혼자 하실까봐 한다고 한거죠..
"You're good at refusing~ Since someone to play appeared, I said I'd play because I was worried you'd play alone..."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 거절 - "refusal" - Declining/rejection
• 잘하시네요~ - "you're good at" - 잘하다 (to do well) + 시 (honorific) + 네요 (observation) + elongated tone
• 하시는 - "playing/doing" - 하다 (to do/play) + 시 (honorific) + 는 (modifier)
• 분 - "person" - Polite counter for people
• 생겼으니까 - "since there appeared" - 생기다 (to appear/arise) + 었으니까 (since/because)
• 혼자 - "alone" - By oneself
• 하실까봐 - "worried you might do" - 하다 (to do) + 시 (honorific) + ㄹ까봐 (worried that/in case)
• 한다고 - "said I would do" - 하다 (to do) + ㄴ다고 (quotative)
• 한거죠.. - "that's what I did" - 하다 (to do) + ㄴ 거 (nominalizer) + 죠 (confirmatory) + trailing
Grammar Deep Dive: "거절 잘하시네요~" is a teasing observation with elongated tone. "하시는 분 생겼으니까" explains the changed circumstances. "혼자 하실까봐 한다고 한거죠" reveals the ISFJ's true motivation - they volunteered only to prevent someone playing alone, confirming the earlier personality prediction perfectly.
Sentence 6
게임 BJ시니까 게임 BJ는 보드게임도 할 줄 알아야 돼 좋았어!
"Since you're a game streamer, game streamers should also know how to play board games. Great!"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 게임 - "game" - Gaming/games
• BJ시니까 - "since you're a BJ" - BJ (broadcast jockey/streamer) + 시 (honorific) + 니까 (since/because)
• 게임 BJ는 - "game streamers" - Game BJ + 는 (topic particle)
• 보드게임도 - "board games too" - 보드게임 (board games) + 도 (also/too)
• 할 줄 알아야 돼 - "should know how to do" - 하다 (to do) + ㄹ 줄 알다 (know how to) + 야 되다 (should/must)
• 좋았어! - "great!" - 좋다 (to be good) + past + exclamation
Grammar Deep Dive: "게임 BJ시니까" identifies someone's profession. "할 줄 알아야 돼" expresses professional expectation using ability + obligation structure. "좋았어!" shows satisfaction at discovering relevant skills. This reveals someone is a game streamer, adding context to their gaming expertise and social dynamics.
Sentence 7
아니 지금 머릿속으로는 아~ 진짜 개 하기 싫은데 그런 것 같아 그런 거 같은데
"No, right now in my head it's like 'ah~ I really fucking don't want to do this' I think that's how it is, I think that's how it is"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아니 - "no" - Negative response or correction
• 지금 - "now/right now" - Current time
• 머릿속으로는 - "in my head" - 머릿속 (inside head) + 으로 (by means of) + 는 (topic)
• 아~ - "ah~" - Elongated interjection of frustration
• 진짜 - "really" - Intensifier meaning truly
• 개 - Intensifying profanity (very strong intensifier)
• 하기 싫은데 - "don't want to do" - 하다 (to do) + 기 싫다 (don't want to) + 는데 (but/though)
• 그런 것 같아 - "I think it's like that" - 그렇다 (to be so) + ㄴ 것 같다 (seems like)
• 그런 거 같은데 - "I think it's like that though" - Same meaning with casual form + 는데
Grammar Deep Dive: "머릿속으로는" contrasts internal thoughts with external behavior. "진짜 개 하기 싫은데" uses strong profanity (개) as intensifier expressing genuine reluctance. The repetition "그런 것 같아 그런 거 같은데" shows uncertainty about expressing this honest feeling. This reveals the gap between social politeness and internal reluctance.
Sentence 8
난 욕먹어도 상관 없는 타입이거든 그러면 셋이서 하는 거예요?
"I'm the type who doesn't mind getting criticized. So are we playing with three people?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 난 - "I" - Casual contraction of 나는 (I + topic)
• 욕먹어도 - "even if criticized" - 욕먹다 (to be criticized/cursed at) + 어도 (even if)
• 상관 없는 - "doesn't matter" - 상관없다 (to not matter) + 는 (modifier)
• 타입이거든 - "type, you know" - 타입 (type) + 이다 (to be) + 거든 (explanatory)
• 그러면 - "then/so" - Logical connector
• 셋이서 - "three people" - 셋 (three) + 이서 (together)
• 하는 거예요? - "are we doing?" - 하다 (to do) + 는 거 (nominalizer) + 예요 (polite question)
Grammar Deep Dive: "욕먹어도 상관 없는 타입이거든" reveals personality trait - resilience to criticism. "그러면 셋이서 하는 거예요?" transitions to practical organization. This shows someone who's comfortable being direct/honest because they can handle negative feedback, explaining their willingness to express reluctance.
Sentence 9
그럼요 하고 있으면은 괜히 끼고 싶은 사람이 생길 거라니까요
"Of course. If we're playing, people who want to join for no reason will appear"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그럼요 - "of course" - Emphatic agreement
• 하고 있으면은 - "if we're doing" - 하다 (to do) + 고 있다 (progressive) + 면 (if) + 은 (topic emphasis)
• 괜히 - "for no reason/unnecessarily" - Adverb meaning without particular reason
• 끼고 싶은 - "wanting to join" - 끼다 (to join/butt in) + 고 싶다 (want to) + ㄴ (modifier)
• 사람이 - "people (subject)" - 사람 (person) + 이 (subject particle)
• 생길 거라니까요 - "will appear, I tell you" - 생기다 (to appear) + ㄹ 거 (future) + 라니까요 (insistent explanation)
Grammar Deep Dive: "하고 있으면은" uses double conditional marking for emphasis. "괜히 끼고 싶은 사람이" describes people wanting to join without good reason. "생길 거라니까요" uses 라니까요 to insist on this prediction. This shows understanding of group dynamics - visible activities attract additional participants.
Sentence 10
그냥 화장실을 왔다갔다 쓰게 될 거 같으니까 변기!
"We'll probably just end up going back and forth to the bathroom, so toilet!"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그냥 - "just" - Adverb meaning simply
• 화장실을 - "bathroom (object)" - 화장실 (bathroom) + 을 (object particle)
• 왔다갔다 - "back and forth" - 오다 (come) + 가다 (go) + repeated
• 쓰게 될 거 같으니까 - "will probably end up using" - 쓰다 (to use) + 게 되다 (end up) + ㄹ 것 같다 (probably) + 으니까 (since)
• 변기! - "toilet!" - Direct/crude term for toilet with exclamation
Grammar Deep Dive: "왔다갔다 쓰게 될 거 같으니까" predicts practical bathroom usage patterns. "변기!" is a sudden, crude exclamation about toilets. This appears to be random commentary or possibly someone being spontaneously crude/funny, showing the casual comfort level of the group.
Sentence 1
우선은! 나눠서 살짝 해 놓으시죠
"First! Let's divide it and set it up slightly/briefly"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 우선은 - "first/for now" - 우선 (first/priority) + 은 (topic particle, emphasizing "for now")
• 나눠서 - "dividing/by dividing" - 나누다 (to divide) + 어서 (connective ending showing method/sequence)
• 살짝 - "slightly/briefly/lightly" - Adverb meaning to do something lightly or temporarily
• 해 놓으시죠 - "let's do/set up" - 하다 (to do) + 놓다 (auxiliary verb for completion) + 시 (honorific) + 죠 (casual suggestion ending)
Grammar Deep Dive: This sentence shows casual but polite instruction-giving. The 놓다 auxiliary verb suggests doing something and leaving it in that state. The 시죠 ending is a polite suggestion form commonly used when giving directions. The speaker is suggesting to temporarily set something up, implying it's not the final arrangement.
Sentence 2
아 위아래? 위아래로 나눠 놓으시는데
"Ah, top and bottom? You're dividing it top and bottom, but..."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아 - "ah/oh" - Interjection expressing realization or acknowledgment
• 위아래? - "top and bottom?" - 위 (top/above) + 아래 (bottom/below), said with questioning intonation
• 위아래로 - "in a top-bottom manner" - Same compound + 로 (directional particle showing method)
• 나눠 놓으시는데 - "you're dividing/setting up, but..." - 나누다 + 놓다 + 시 (honorific) + 는데 (ongoing action with "but" implication)
Grammar Deep Dive: The 는데 ending suggests the speaker is observing what the listener is doing and is about to add a comment or suggestion. It creates a sense of "I see you're doing this, but..." The repetition of 위아래 with different particles shows the speaker clarifying the method being used.
Sentence 3
급할 때는 쓰셔도 상관은 없는데 그러면은 남자가 아래 쓰고 이렇게
"When it's urgent, it's fine to use it, but then the man uses the bottom like this"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 급할 때는 - "when it's urgent" - 급하다 (to be urgent) + ㄹ 때 (when) + 는 (topic particle)
• 쓰셔도 - "even if you use" - 쓰다 (to use) + 셔 (honorific) + 도 (even if/also)
• 상관은 없는데 - "it doesn't matter, but" - 상관없다 (doesn't matter) + 는데 (but/however)
• 그러면은 - "then/in that case" - 그러면 (then) + 은 (topic particle for emphasis)
• 남자가 - "man (subject)" - 남자 (man) + 가 (subject particle)
• 아래 쓰고 - "uses the bottom and" - 아래 (bottom) + 쓰다 (to use) + 고 (and/connective)
• 이렇게 - "like this/in this way" - Demonstrative adverb
Grammar Deep Dive: This appears to be explaining bathroom etiquette or usage rules. The polite language (쓰셔도) shows respect while giving permission. The 는데 structure introduces a condition or exception. This is typical instructional Korean with conditional and explanatory language patterns.
Sentence 4
커버 커버만 그냥 그런 건 전혀 상관없고
"Just covers, covers only - that kind of thing doesn't matter at all"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 커버 - "cover" - English loanword, repeated for emphasis
• 커버만 - "only covers" - 커버 + 만 (only/just)
• 그냥 - "just/simply" - Adverb meaning casually or simply
• 그런 건 - "that kind of thing" - 그런 (that kind of) + 것 (thing) + 은 contracted
• 전혀 - "at all/completely" - Adverb used with negatives for emphasis
• 상관없고 - "doesn't matter and" - 상관없다 (doesn't matter) + 고 (and/connective)
Grammar Deep Dive: The repetition of "커버" shows casual speech patterns. 전혀 with 상관없다 creates strong negation meaning "absolutely doesn't matter." This is reassuring language, telling someone not to worry about something specific (covers/protective items).
Sentence 5
아니 저는 쌀지언정 아래만 쓰겠습니다
"No, I would rather die than (do that) - I'll only use the bottom"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아니 - "no/not" - Negation particle, also interjection
• 저는 - "I (humble)" - 저 (humble first person) + 는 (topic particle)
• 쌀지언정 - "even if I die/rather die" - 죽다 (to die) in archaic form + 지언정 (even if/rather than)
• 아래만 - "only the bottom" - 아래 (bottom) + 만 (only)
• 쓰겠습니다 - "I will use" - 쓰다 (to use) + 겠 (intention/will) + 습니다 (formal polite ending)
Grammar Deep Dive: 쌀지언정 is a dramatic, somewhat archaic expression meaning "even if I die" - showing extreme determination. The contrast between this dramatic expression and the formal 습니다 ending creates humor. The speaker is being overly dramatic about a simple preference, which is common in Korean humor.
Sentence 6
실수할까 봐 제가 죄스러워서 안되면 I쪽에 가가지고 쓸게요 제가
"I'm worried I might make a mistake, I feel guilty, so if not, I'll go to the other side and use it"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 실수할까 봐 - "worried about making a mistake" - 실수하다 (to make a mistake) + ㄹ까 봐 (worried that)
• 제가 - "I (humble subject)" - 저 (humble I) + 가 (subject particle)
• 죄스러워서 - "feeling guilty/sorry" - 죄스럽다 (to feel guilty) + 어서 (because/so)
• 안되면 - "if it doesn't work/if not okay" - 안 되다 (to not work) + 면 (if)
• I쪽에 - "to the other side" - I (that) + 쪽 (side/direction) + 에 (to)
• 가가지고 - "going and" - 가다 (to go) + 가지고 (taking/and then, casual connective)
• 쓸게요 - "I will use" - 쓰다 (to use) + ㄹ게요 (gentle future intention)
Grammar Deep Dive: This shows typical Korean consideration for others. ㄹ까 봐 expresses worry about potential problems. 죄스럽다 shows the speaker feels bad about potentially inconveniencing others. 가가지고 is casual, colloquial Korean. The overall tone is very humble and considerate.
Sentence 7
아~ 저기요! 화장실!
"Ah~ Excuse me! Bathroom!"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아~ - "ah~" - Extended interjection showing realization or urgency
• 저기요! - "excuse me!" - 저기 (over there, used to get attention) + 요 (polite particle)
• 화장실! - "bathroom/restroom!" - Noun for toilet/bathroom
Grammar Deep Dive: This is a sudden, urgent interjection. 저기요 is the polite way to get someone's attention, literally meaning "over there" but functioning like "excuse me." The exclamation marks and fragmented speech suggest urgency - likely someone needing to find or use the bathroom quickly.
Sentence 8
I분들 막 긴급 연락망 전화하는 거 아니냐고 이상한 사람이 왔어요!
"These people might be calling the emergency contact network or something - a strange person came!"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• I분들 - "these people" - I (these) + 분들 (people, honorific plural)
• 막 - "just/randomly" - Adverb meaning recklessly or without much thought
• 긴급 연락망 - "emergency contact network" - 긴급 (emergency) + 연락망 (contact network)
• 전화하는 거 - "calling/the act of calling" - 전화하다 (to call) + 는 것 (nominalizer)
• 아니냐고 - "wondering if it's not/might be" - 아니다 (to not be) + 냐고 (indirect question marker)
• 이상한 사람이 - "strange person (subject)" - 이상하다 (strange) + 사람 (person) + 이 (subject)
• 왔어요! - "came!" - 오다 (to come) + 았어요 (past tense polite)
Grammar Deep Dive: This sentence shows concern about people possibly overreacting to a situation. The 아니냐고 structure expresses the speaker's speculation about what others might be thinking. The tone suggests mild panic or concern about an unusual situation developing.
Sentence 9
이거 봐도 되는 거예요? 자기만 봐야 돼요 까먹었다
"Is it okay to look at this? You should only look at your own. I forgot."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 이거 - "this" - Demonstrative pronoun for nearby objects
• 봐도 되는 거예요? - "is it okay to look?" - 보다 (to look) + 도 되다 (permission) + 는 것 + 예요 (polite question)
• 자기만 - "only your own" - 자기 (oneself) + 만 (only)
• 봐야 돼요 - "should look/must look" - 보다 + 야 되다 (must/should) + 요
• 까먹었다 - "I forgot" - 까먹다 (to forget, casual) + 었다 (past tense)
Grammar Deep Dive: This shows rule-clarification in what appears to be a game situation. 봐도 되다 is the standard permission-asking structure. The sudden shift to 까먹었다 (casual past tense) after polite speech suggests the speaker is talking to themselves or showing frustration about forgetting a rule.
Sentence 10
이렇게 하고 여기 카드를 놔둬 자 그러면은 일단은 제가 먼저 해볼게요
"Do it like this and put the card here. Now then, first I'll try doing it."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 이렇게 하고 - "do like this and" - 이렇게 (like this) + 하다 (to do) + 고 (and)
• 여기 - "here" - Demonstrative for location
• 카드를 - "card (object)" - 카드 (card) + 를 (object particle)
• 놔둬 - "put/place" - 놓아두다 (to put and leave) in casual imperative form
• 자 - "now/well" - Interjection to get attention or transition
• 그러면은 - "then/in that case" - 그러면 + 은 (emphasis)
• 일단은 - "first/for now" - 일단 (first) + 은 (topic particle)
• 제가 먼저 해볼게요 - "I'll try doing it first" - 저 + 가 (humble I) + 먼저 (first) + 해보다 (try doing) + ㄹ게요
Grammar Deep Dive: This is typical game instruction language. The shift from casual commands (놔둬) to polite volunteer statements (해볼게요) shows the speaker taking charge but remaining polite. 해보다 means "try doing" - suggesting this might be experimental or the first attempt.
Sentence 11
이렇게 순서 이렇게 돌아가도록 하고 이게 처음에 어떻게 해야 되냐면은 카드를 한 장은 무조건 써야 돼요
"Make the order go around like this, and as for how to do this initially - you must unconditionally use one card."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 이렇게 순서 - "order like this" - 이렇게 (like this) + 순서 (order/sequence)
• 돌아가도록 하고 - "make it go around and" - 돌아가다 (to go around) + 도록 하다 (make it so that)
• 이게 - "this (subject)" - 이것 + 이 contracted
• 처음에 - "at first/initially" - 처음 (beginning) + 에 (at/in)
• 어떻게 해야 되냐면은 - "as for how to do it" - 어떻게 (how) + 하다 (do) + 야 되다 (must) + 냐면 (if you ask) + 은
• 카드를 한 장은 - "one card (topic)" - 카드 (card) + 를 (object) + 한 장 (one sheet) + 은 (topic)
• 무조건 - "unconditionally/definitely" - Adverb meaning without exception
• 써야 돼요 - "must use" - 쓰다 (to use) + 야 되다 (must) + 요 (polite)
Grammar Deep Dive: This is complex rule explanation. 도록 하다 means "make it so that" - a causative structure. 냐면은 is "if you ask how/as for how" - a common way to introduce explanations. 무조건 emphasizes the absolute nature of the rule. This is typical Korean game instruction with multiple embedded clauses.
Sentence 1
카드 한 장을 무조건 써야 되는데 뭐 일단 전진을 하는 게 좋겠죠? 전진을 하면서 하나 쓰고
"You must unconditionally use one card, but well, it would be good to advance first, right? Advancing while using one"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 카드 한 장을 - "one card (object)" - 카드 (card) + 한 장 (one sheet) + 을 (object particle)
• 무조건 - "unconditionally/definitely" - Adverb meaning without exception
• 써야 되는데 - "must use, but" - 쓰다 (to use) + 야 되다 (must) + 는데 (but/however)
• 뭐 - "well/what" - Filler word, casual interjection
• 일단 - "first/for now" - Adverb meaning "to begin with"
• 전진을 하는 게 - "advancing/moving forward" - 전진 (advance) + 을 하다 (to do) + 는 것 (nominalizer)
• 좋겠죠? - "would be good, right?" - 좋다 (good) + 겠 (conjecture) + 죠 (seeking agreement)
• 전진을 하면서 - "while advancing" - 전진 + 을 하다 + 면서 (while doing)
• 하나 쓰고 - "using one and" - 하나 (one) + 쓰다 (use) + 고 (and)
Grammar Deep Dive: Game strategy discussion. 는데 introduces contrasting idea - there's a rule but the speaker suggests a strategy. 겠죠 seeks agreement on the proposed strategy. 면서 shows simultaneous actions (advancing while using cards). This shows collaborative game planning.
Sentence 2
버릴 수가 있구나 네 오 됐다! 끝난 거잖아 그럼
"I can discard! Yes, oh, it's done! It's finished then"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 버릴 수가 있구나 - "I can discard!" - 버리다 (to throw away/discard) + ㄹ 수 있다 (can/able to) + 구나 (realization exclamation)
• 네 - "yes" - Affirmative response
• 오 - "oh" - Exclamation of surprise or realization
• 됐다! - "it's done/finished!" - 되다 (to become/be done) + 았다 (past tense, casual)
• 끝난 거잖아 - "it's finished, you know" - 끝나다 (to end) + ㄴ 것 (nominalizer) + 잖아 (you know/obviously)
• 그럼 - "then/in that case" - Shortened form of 그러면
Grammar Deep Dive: Shows sudden realization about game possibility with 구나. The speaker discovers they can discard, which apparently ends the game. 잖아 appeals to shared understanding - "obviously it's finished." This captures the excitement of discovering a winning move in a game.
Sentence 3
이럼 광부의 승리인가요? 네 이거 너무 이기기 쉬운 거 아닌가? 너무 쉬운데요
"Like this, is it the miner's victory? Yes, isn't this too easy to win? It's too easy"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 이럼 - "like this/if it's like this" - 이렇다 + 면 (if) contracted
• 광부의 - "miner's" - 광부 (miner) + 의 (possessive particle)
• 승리인가요? - "is it victory?" - 승리 (victory) + 인가 (is it?) + 요 (polite)
• 네 - "yes" - Affirmative response
• 이거 - "this" - Demonstrative pronoun
• 너무 - "too/very" - Adverb for excess
• 이기기 쉬운 거 - "easy to win thing" - 이기다 (to win) + 기 (nominalizer) + 쉽다 (easy) + 는 것
• 아닌가? - "isn't it?" - 아니다 (not) + ㄴ가 (questioning ending)
• 너무 쉬운데요 - "it's too easy" - 너무 + 쉽다 + 은데요 (casual observation ending)
Grammar Deep Dive: Shows concern about game balance. 인가요 asks for confirmation about the victory condition. 아닌가 seeks agreement about the difficulty level being problematic. This reveals the speaker thinks the game might be too easy and perhaps something is wrong with the rules.
Sentence 4
뭔가 잘못됐어 이렇게 내가 쉽게 질 리가 없어 룰이 잘못된 걸 거야 얘기나 하죠
"Something's wrong. There's no way I would lose this easily. The rules must be wrong. Let's talk about it."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 뭔가 - "something" - 뭔 (what) + 가 (subject), casual contraction
• 잘못됐어 - "is wrong/messed up" - 잘못되다 (to go wrong) + 었어 (past tense casual)
• 이렇게 - "like this/this way" - Demonstrative adverb
• 내가 - "I (subject)" - 나 (I) + 가 (subject particle)
• 쉽게 - "easily" - 쉽다 (easy) + 게 (adverb form)
• 질 리가 없어 - "there's no way I'd lose" - 지다 (lose) + ㄹ 리가 없다 (no possibility)
• 룰이 - "rules (subject)" - 룰 (rule, English loanword) + 이 (subject)
• 잘못된 걸 거야 - "must be wrong" - 잘못되다 + ㄴ 것 + 일 거야 (speculation)
• 얘기나 하죠 - "let's just talk" - 얘기 (talk) + 나 (just/at least) + 하다 + 죠 (suggestion)
Grammar Deep Dive: Shows frustration and denial about losing. 리가 없다 expresses strong impossibility - the speaker can't accept losing so easily. 일 거야 shows strong speculation/assumption. 나 suggests "at least" or "just" - a face-saving suggestion to discuss the rules rather than accept defeat.
Sentence 5
제가 딱히 일부러 진 건 아닌데 져서 재미없으신 거 아니에요?
"It's not like I lost on purpose, but aren't you bored because you lost?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 제가 - "I (humble subject)" - 저 (humble I) + 가 (subject)
• 딱히 - "particularly/specifically" - Adverb meaning "not particularly"
• 일부러 - "on purpose/intentionally" - Adverb meaning deliberately
• 진 건 아닌데 - "it's not that I lost, but" - 지다 (lose) + ㄴ 것 (nominalizer) + 아니다 + 는데
• 져서 - "because you lost" - 지다 + 어서 (because/so)
• 재미없으신 거 - "boring thing (honorific)" - 재미없다 (boring) + 으신 (honorific) + 것
• 아니에요? - "isn't it?" - 아니다 + 에요 (polite question)
Grammar Deep Dive: Shows polite concern about the opponent's feelings. 딱히...아닌데 structure provides mild denial without being too direct. 으신 shows respect for the other person's feelings. This demonstrates Korean consideration for others even in competitive situations - worrying that the other person might be bored by winning too easily.
Sentence 6
아니 이게 뭔가 막 그 막 추측하고 막 추리하고 해야 되는데 그냥 바로 끝나버렸어
"No, this should be something where you guess and deduce and stuff, but it just ended right away"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아니 - "no/not" - Negation/disagreement interjection
• 이게 - "this (subject)" - 이것 + 이 contracted
• 뭔가 - "something" - 뭔 + 가, casual form
• 막 - "just/randomly" - Adverb meaning recklessly or emphasizing
• 그 막 - "that, just" - 그 (that) + 막 (repetition for emphasis)
• 추측하고 - "guessing and" - 추측 (speculation) + 하다 + 고 (and)
• 막 추리하고 - "just deducing and" - 막 + 추리 (deduction) + 하다 + 고
• 해야 되는데 - "should do, but" - 하다 + 야 되다 (should) + 는데 (but)
• 그냥 - "just/simply" - Adverb meaning simply
• 바로 - "right away/immediately" - Adverb meaning directly/immediately
• 끝나버렸어 - "ended up finishing" - 끝나다 (end) + 버리다 (completive auxiliary) + 었어 (past casual)
Grammar Deep Dive: Shows frustration about game expectations not being met. The repetition of 막 emphasizes casual speech and frustration. 버리다 auxiliary verb shows undesirable completion - the game "ended up finishing" when it shouldn't have. This reveals the speaker expected a complex deduction game but it ended too quickly and simply.
Sentence 7
아니 생각을 잘못했어 잘못된 거예요 못하는 거예요?
"No, I thought wrong. It's wrong. Can't we do it?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아니 - "no" - Negation interjection
• 생각을 - "thinking (object)" - 생각 (thought) + 을 (object particle)
• 잘못했어 - "did wrong" - 잘못하다 (to do wrong) + 었어 (past tense casual)
• 잘못된 거예요 - "it's wrong" - 잘못되다 (to be wrong) + ㄴ 것 + 예요 (polite)
• 못하는 거예요? - "can't we do it?" - 못하다 (can't do) + 는 것 + 예요 (polite question)
Grammar Deep Dive: Shows self-correction and questioning about the situation. The shift from casual (했어) to polite (거예요) shows the speaker is being more considerate while asking for clarification. 못하는 거예요 asks about inability or permission - whether they can't continue or aren't allowed to. This shows the speaker trying to understand what went wrong with the game.
Sentence 1
일침 우리 규칙 다 정했으면 MBTI 코너니까
"Well then, since we've decided all our rules, it's the MBTI corner"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 일침 - "well then/first" - Actually should be "일단" (first/for now) - appears to be a speech error or dialectal variation
• 우리 - "our/we" - First person plural pronoun
• 규칙 - "rules" - Noun meaning regulations or rules
• 다 - "all/completely" - Adverb meaning entirely
• 정했으면 - "if we decided" - 정하다 (to decide) + 았으면 (if/since conditional)
• MBTI 코너니까 - "since it's MBTI corner" - MBTI + 코너 (corner/segment) + 니까 (since/because)
Grammar Deep Dive: 았으면 here functions as "since" rather than "if" - showing completed action leading to a logical next step. 니까 provides reasoning for the suggestion that follows. This is typical Korean show/broadcast language transitioning between segments.
Sentence 2
MBTI에 관한 얘기를 해보는 건 어떨까요? 지금 내가 가지고 있는 MBTI는 이건데
"How about we try talking about MBTI? The MBTI I currently have is this, but..."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• MBTI에 관한 - "related to MBTI" - MBTI + 에 관한 (relating to/about)
• 얘기를 - "talking/story (object)" - 얘기 (talk/story) + 를 (object particle)
• 해보는 건 - "trying to do" - 해보다 (try doing) + 는 것 (nominalizer)
• 어떨까요? - "how would it be?" - 어떻다 (how) + ㄹ까요 (suggestion/wonder)
• 지금 - "now/currently" - Time adverb
• 내가 - "I (subject)" - 나 (I) + 가 (subject particle)
• 가지고 있는 - "having/possessing" - 가지다 (to have) + 고 있다 (continuous) + 는 (modifier)
• MBTI는 이건데 - "MBTI is this, but" - MBTI + 는 (topic) + 이다 (this) + 건데 (but/however)
Grammar Deep Dive: ㄹ까요 is a polite way to make suggestions. "가지고 있는" treats MBTI as something you possess rather than something you are, showing Korean conceptualization of personality types. 건데 sets up for elaboration or contrast.
Sentence 3
지금 내가 가지고 있는 이 MBTI의 편견은 이런 것이며 나는 이거랑 좀 다르다 라던가
"The prejudice about this MBTI I currently have is like this, and I'm somewhat different from this, or something like that"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 지금 내가 가지고 있는 - "that I currently have" - Same structure as previous sentence
• 이 MBTI의 - "this MBTI's" - 이 (this) + MBTI + 의 (possessive)
• 편견은 - "prejudice/bias (topic)" - 편견 (prejudice/stereotype) + 은 (topic particle)
• 이런 것이며 - "is like this and" - 이런 것 (this kind of thing) + 이다 + 며 (and, formal connective)
• 나는 - "I (topic)" - 나 (I) + 는 (topic particle)
• 이거랑 - "with this" - 이것 (this) + 랑 (with/and, casual)
• 좀 - "a bit/somewhat" - Adverb meaning slightly
• 다르다 - "different" - Adjective meaning to be different
• 라던가 - "or something like that" - Ending showing examples or vague listing
Grammar Deep Dive: 며 is a formal connective often used in written or structured speech. 라던가 is used to give examples or suggest similar possibilities without being exhaustive. This shows the speaker is outlining a discussion format about MBTI stereotypes vs. reality.
Sentence 4
귀여워 저희 인터뷰할 때 했던 얘기들 난 너무 좋다고 생각해 난 너무 좋아
"Cute! The stories we did during our interview - I think they're so good, I like them so much"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 귀여워 - "cute!" - 귀엽다 (to be cute) + 어 (casual exclamation)
• 저희 - "we (humble)" - Humble first person plural pronoun
• 인터뷰할 때 - "when interviewing" - 인터뷰 (interview) + 할 때 (when doing)
• 했던 얘기들 - "stories we did" - 하다 (to do) + 던 (past modifier) + 얘기 (stories) + 들 (plural)
• 난 - "I" - Casual contraction of 나는
• 너무 좋다고 생각해 - "think it's so good" - 너무 (so/very) + 좋다 (good) + 고 생각하다 (to think that)
• 난 너무 좋아 - "I like it so much" - 나 + 는 + 너무 + 좋아하다 (to like)
Grammar Deep Dive: The speaker shows excitement through repetition and casual speech. 던 refers to past habitual or repeated actions. The repetition of "너무 좋다/좋아" emphasizes strong positive feelings. This shows enthusiasm about their previous interview content.
Sentence 5
너무 귀여워 이게 되게 ESFP가 항상 인싸고 말 많고
"So cute! This is really like how ESFP is always popular and talkative"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 너무 귀여워 - "so cute" - 너무 (so/very) + 귀엽다 + 어 (casual exclamation)
• 이게 - "this (subject)" - 이것 + 이 contracted
• 되게 - "really/very" - Adverb meaning quite/really (casual form of 정말)
• ESFP가 - "ESFP (subject)" - MBTI personality type + 가 (subject particle)
• 항상 - "always" - Adverb meaning consistently
• 인싸고 - "popular and" - 인싸 (insider/popular person, slang) + 고 (and)
• 말 많고 - "talkative and" - 말 (words/speech) + 많다 (many) + 고 (and)
Grammar Deep Dive: 인싸 is modern slang from "insider" - someone who's socially popular/connected. The sentence structure lists typical ESFP stereotypes. The speaker is building up to contrast these stereotypes with their own experience.
Sentence 6
뭐든지 나누고 요런 편견이 있는데 편견 때문에 여기가 나오기가 무서웠어요
"Sharing everything and this kind of prejudice exists, but because of the prejudice, I was scared for this to come out"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 뭐든지 - "anything/everything" - 뭐 (what) + 든지 (whatever/any)
• 나누고 - "sharing and" - 나누다 (to share/divide) + 고 (and)
• 요런 - "this kind of" - Casual form of 이런 (this kind of)
• 편견이 있는데 - "prejudice exists, but" - 편견 (prejudice) + 이 있다 (exists) + 는데 (but)
• 편견 때문에 - "because of prejudice" - 편견 + 때문에 (because of/due to)
• 여기가 - "this (subject)" - 여기 (here/this) + 가 (subject particle)
• 나오기가 - "coming out" - 나오다 (to come out) + 기 (nominalizer) + 가 (subject)
• 무서웠어요 - "was scary" - 무섭다 (to be scary/frightening) + 었어요 (past polite)
Grammar Deep Dive: 든지 means "any/whatever" when attached to question words. 요런 is dialectal/casual for 이런. The 기가 structure nominalizes the action of "coming out" (presumably referring to MBTI results). This shows the speaker's anxiety about MBTI stereotypes affecting how others perceive them.
Sentence 7
왜냐면 저는 그런 성격이랑 사뭇 다른 거 같아서 내가 알던 ESFP는 저런 사람이 아니었는데?
"Because I seem quite different from that personality, the ESFP I knew wasn't that kind of person, you know?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 왜냐면 - "because" - 왜냐하면 (because) shortened to casual form
• 저는 - "I (humble topic)" - 저 (humble I) + 는 (topic particle)
• 그런 성격이랑 - "with that personality" - 그런 (that kind of) + 성격 (personality) + 이랑 (with, casual)
• 사뭇 - "quite/considerably" - Formal adverb meaning significantly
• 다른 거 같아서 - "seem different, so" - 다르다 (different) + 는 것 같다 (seem like) + 어서 (so/because)
• 내가 알던 - "that I knew" - 나 + 가 + 알다 (to know) + 던 (past habitual modifier)
• ESFP는 - "ESFP (topic)" - ESFP + 는 (topic particle)
• 저런 사람이 - "that kind of person" - 저런 (that kind of) + 사람 (person) + 이 (subject)
• 아니었는데? - "wasn't, you know?" - 아니다 (not) + 었는데 (past + questioning/explanatory tone)
Grammar Deep Dive: 사뭇 is a more literary/formal word mixed into casual speech, showing the speaker's education level. 던 indicates the speaker's past knowledge/experience with ESFP people. The questioning 는데 at the end seeks understanding or agreement about the discrepancy between stereotype and reality.
Sentence 1
진자림은 아닌 거 아니냐? 이러면 어쩌지 하고 걱정하고 나왔습니다 똑같은 고민한 거 같아요
"Isn't it not the real deal? I worried 'what if this happens?' and came out. I think we had the same concerns."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 진자림은 - "real deal (topic)" - 진짜 (real) dialect variation + 림 (unclear, possibly 리 ending) + 은 (topic)
• 아닌 거 - "not being/the thing that's not" - 아니다 (not) + ㄴ 것 (nominalizer)
• 아니냐? - "isn't it?" - 아니다 + 냐 (question ending seeking agreement)
• 이러면 - "if it's like this" - 이렇다 (like this) + 면 (if/when)
• 어쩌지 - "what should I do" - 어쩌다 (what to do) + 지 (wondering/concern ending)
• 하고 걱정하고 - "thinking and worrying" - 하다 (do/think) + 고 + 걱정하다 (worry) + 고
• 나왔습니다 - "came out" - 나오다 (come out) + 았습니다 (past formal polite)
• 똑같은 - "same/identical" - Adjective meaning exactly the same
• 고민한 거 같아요 - "seems like we worried" - 고민하다 (worry/ponder) + ㄴ 것 같다 (seems like)
Grammar Deep Dive: 진자림 appears to be a dialectal or casual pronunciation of 진짜 with an added sound. The 지 ending in 어쩌지 shows internal worry or contemplation. The speaker is sharing their pre-appearance anxiety about authentically representing their MBTI type, seeking validation that others felt the same way.
Sentence 2
아 진짜로 다 근데 그러지 않았을까요? 뭔가 괜히 대표하게 된 거 같아서
"Oh really, everyone probably felt that way, right? Because it feels like we ended up representing something for no reason"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 아 진짜로 - "oh really" - 아 (oh) + 진짜 (really) + 로 (adverb marker)
• 다 - "all/everyone" - Pronoun meaning all people
• 근데 - "but/however" - Casual form of 그런데
• 그러지 않았을까요? - "probably did that, right?" - 그러다 (do so) + 지 않았을까 (probably did) + 요
• 뭔가 - "something/somehow" - 무언가 contracted to casual form
• 괜히 - "for no reason/unnecessarily" - Adverb meaning without cause
• 대표하게 된 거 같아서 - "seems like ended up representing" - 대표하다 (represent) + 게 되다 (end up) + 것 같다 + 어서
Grammar Deep Dive: 지 않았을까요 is a polite way to suggest probability - "probably did/felt that way." 게 되다 indicates unintentional result - they didn't choose to represent but ended up in that position. 괜히 suggests the burden feels undeserved or accidental.
Sentence 3
분명히 보면서 아 ENFP 안 저런데? 이럴까봐 너무 다 성향이 그 안에서 다르니까
"While watching, thinking 'ah, ENFP isn't like that though?' - worried about this reaction because everyone's tendencies are so different within that"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 분명히 - "clearly/definitely" - Adverb meaning obviously
• 보면서 - "while watching" - 보다 (see/watch) + 면서 (while doing)
• 아 ENFP 안 저런데? - "ah, ENFP isn't like that though?" - 아 (ah) + ENFP + 안 (not) + 저렇다 (like that) + 는데 (but)
• 이럴까봐 - "worried this might happen" - 이렇다 (like this) + ㄹ까봐 (worried that)
• 너무 - "too/very" - Adverb for emphasis
• 다 성향이 - "all the tendencies" - 다 (all) + 성향 (tendency/inclination) + 이 (subject)
• 그 안에서 - "within that" - 그 (that) + 안 (inside) + 에서 (in/from)
• 다르니까 - "because they're different" - 다르다 (different) + 니까 (because)
Grammar Deep Dive: ㄹ까봐 expresses worry about potential negative outcomes. The speaker anticipates criticism from viewers who know other ENFPs. This shows awareness that personality types have wide variation within categories, and fear of misrepresenting the type.
Sentence 4
어떻게 16개로 나뉠 수가 있겠어요 맞아 딱 그 생각 찾아본 거중에 하나가
"How could it be divided into just 16 types? Right, exactly that thought - one of the things I looked up was"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 어떻게 - "how" - Question word asking about method
• 16개로 - "into 16" - 16 + 개 (counter for items) + 로 (into/by means of)
• 나뉠 수가 있겠어요 - "could be divided" - 나누어지다 (be divided) + ㄹ 수 있다 (can) + 겠어요 (possibility/conjecture)
• 맞아 - "right/correct" - 맞다 (correct) + 아 (casual affirmation)
• 딱 - "exactly/precisely" - Adverb meaning precisely
• 그 생각 - "that thought" - 그 (that) + 생각 (thought/idea)
• 찾아본 거중에 - "among things I looked up" - 찾아보다 (look up/research) + ㄴ 것 + 중에 (among)
• 하나가 - "one thing" - 하나 (one) + 가 (subject particle)
Grammar Deep Dive: The rhetorical question format 어떻게...수가 있겠어요 expresses disbelief or skepticism. 딱 그 생각 shows strong agreement - "exactly that thought." This transitions into sharing research findings that support their skepticism about MBTI categorization.
Sentence 5
F는 감정의 공감을 먼저 해가지고 그 사람을 위로를 하고
"F types first empathize with emotions and then comfort that person"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• F는 - "F (topic)" - MBTI Feeling type + 는 (topic particle)
• 감정의 - "emotion's/emotional" - 감정 (emotion/feeling) + 의 (possessive)
• 공감을 - "empathy (object)" - 공감 (empathy/sympathy) + 을 (object particle)
• 먼저 - "first" - Adverb indicating sequence
• 해가지고 - "doing and then" - 하다 (do) + 가지고 (casual connective meaning "and then")
• 그 사람을 - "that person (object)" - 그 사람 (that person) + 을 (object particle)
• 위로를 하고 - "comfort and" - 위로 (comfort/consolation) + 를 하다 (do) + 고 (and)
Grammar Deep Dive: 해가지고 is a casual connective showing sequence - "do A and then B." This explains the speaker's understanding of how F-types (Feeling types in MBTI) process emotional situations. The structure presents a step-by-step process: empathize first, then comfort.
Sentence 6
T들은 그 사람을 일단 이해를 해야 해요 이해를 위한 이해가 필요해가지고
"T types need to understand that person first. They need understanding for the sake of understanding"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• T들은 - "T types (topic)" - MBTI Thinking type + 들 (plural) + 은 (topic)
• 그 사람을 - "that person (object)" - 그 사람 + 을 (object particle)
• 일단 - "first/for now" - Adverb meaning "to begin with"
• 이해를 해야 해요 - "need to understand" - 이해 (understanding) + 를 하다 (do) + 야 하다 (must/need to)
• 이해를 위한 - "for understanding" - 이해 + 를 위한 (for the purpose of)
• 이해가 - "understanding (subject)" - 이해 + 가 (subject particle)
• 필요해가지고 - "is needed and so" - 필요하다 (need) + 해가지고 (casual connective)
Grammar Deep Dive: "이해를 위한 이해" is a philosophical concept - understanding for its own sake, not just for practical purposes. This contrasts T-types (Thinking) with F-types, suggesting T-types need intellectual comprehension before they can provide support. The repetition emphasizes the abstract nature of this process.
Sentence 7
공감 같은 걸 할 때 그렇게 한다고 하더라고요 저도 토론을 되게 좋아하는데 저는 되게 다른 부분은
"When doing things like empathy, they say it's done that way. I also really like debates, but the part where I'm really different is..."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 공감 같은 걸 - "things like empathy" - 공감 (empathy) + 같은 것 (things like) contracted
• 할 때 - "when doing" - 하다 + ㄹ 때 (when)
• 그렇게 한다고 하더라고요 - "they say it's done that way" - 그렇게 (that way) + 하다 + 고 하다 (say that) + 더라고요 (reporting what one learned)
• 저도 - "I also" - 저 (humble I) + 도 (also/too)
• 토론을 - "debate/discussion (object)" - 토론 (debate) + 을 (object particle)
• 되게 - "really/very" - Casual adverb meaning quite
• 좋아하는데 - "like, but" - 좋아하다 (like) + 는데 (but/however)
• 저는 되게 다른 부분은 - "the part where I'm really different is" - 저 + 는 + 되게 + 다르다 + 부분 + 은
Grammar Deep Dive: 더라고요 is used when reporting something you learned or discovered, often with slight surprise. The speaker is sharing research findings about T vs F types, then transitioning to personal reflection. 는데 sets up a contrast between liking debates (T-type trait) and having different approaches (suggesting F-type characteristics).
Sentence 1
저도 호기심이 진짜 많은데 토론이나 이런 걸 할 때 항상 그 기준은
"I also have a lot of curiosity, but when doing debates or things like this, that standard is always"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 저도 - "I also" - 저 (humble I) + 도 (also/too)
• 호기심이 - "curiosity (subject)" - 호기심 (curiosity) + 이 (subject particle)
• 진짜 - "really/truly" - Adverb meaning genuinely
• 많은데 - "have a lot, but" - 많다 (many/much) + 은데 (but/however)
• 토론이나 - "debates or" - 토론 (debate/discussion) + 이나 (or)
• 이런 걸 - "things like this" - 이런 것 (this kind of thing) contracted
• 할 때 - "when doing" - 하다 + ㄹ 때 (when)
• 항상 - "always" - Adverb meaning consistently
• 그 기준은 - "that standard (topic)" - 그 (that) + 기준 (standard/criterion) + 은 (topic particle)
Grammar Deep Dive: The speaker contrasts their curiosity (typically T-type trait) with their approach to debates. 은데 sets up this contrast - "I have curiosity BUT my approach is different." This continues the theme of not fitting perfectly into MBTI stereotypes.
Sentence 2
감정이에요 그러니까 너는 왜 그런 상황에서 그런 기분이 들었어? 약간 감정에 대한 토론이라고 해야 되나?
"It's emotion. So like, why did you feel that way in that situation? Should I call it a debate about emotions?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 감정이에요 - "it's emotion" - 감정 (emotion/feeling) + 이에요 (is, polite)
• 그러니까 - "so/therefore" - Conjunction meaning "so" or "in other words"
• 너는 - "you (topic)" - 너 (you, casual) + 는 (topic particle)
• 왜 - "why" - Question word asking for reason
• 그런 상황에서 - "in that situation" - 그런 (that kind of) + 상황 (situation) + 에서 (in/at)
• 그런 기분이 - "that feeling (subject)" - 그런 + 기분 (feeling/mood) + 이 (subject)
• 들었어? - "did you feel?" - 들다 (to feel/arise) + 었어 (past tense casual question)
• 약간 - "kind of/somewhat" - Adverb meaning slightly
• 감정에 대한 - "about emotions" - 감정 + 에 대한 (about/regarding)
• 토론이라고 해야 되나? - "should I call it a debate?" - 토론 + 이라고 하다 (to call) + 야 되다 (should) + 나 (wondering)
Grammar Deep Dive: The speaker gives a direct example of their approach - questioning emotions rather than facts. The casual speech (너는, 들었어) shows how they actually talk in debates. 라고 해야 되나 shows uncertainty about terminology, revealing self-awareness about their unique approach.
Sentence 3
근데 진짜로 그런 마음이 들었던 걸까? 뭔가 다시 한번 물음표를
"But did you really feel that way? Something like putting a question mark once more"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 근데 - "but/however" - Casual form of 그런데
• 진짜로 - "really/truly" - 진짜 (really) + 로 (adverb marker)
• 그런 마음이 - "that feeling/heart (subject)" - 그런 + 마음 (heart/feeling) + 이 (subject)
• 들었던 걸까? - "did you feel?" - 들다 (feel/arise) + 었던 (past experience modifier) + 걸까 (wondering/doubt)
• 뭔가 - "something/somehow" - 무언가 contracted
• 다시 한번 - "once more/again" - 다시 (again) + 한번 (one time)
• 물음표를 - "question mark (object)" - 물음표 (question mark) + 를 (object particle)
Grammar Deep Dive: 었던 걸까 shows reflection on past experiences with doubt - "did that really happen?" This reveals the speaker's tendency to question even emotional experiences. The metaphor of "putting a question mark" shows their analytical approach to feelings.
Sentence 4
갖게 하는 그런 공감입니다 좀 많이 하는 편인 것 같아요
"That kind of empathy that makes you have [doubt]. I think I tend to do this quite a lot"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 갖게 하는 - "makes you have" - 갖다 (to have) + 게 하다 (causative: make someone do)
• 그런 공감입니다 - "that kind of empathy" - 그런 + 공감 (empathy) + 입니다 (formal polite)
• 좀 - "a bit/quite" - Adverb meaning somewhat
• 많이 - "a lot/much" - Adverb meaning frequently
• 하는 편인 것 같아요 - "tend to do/seem to be the type that does" - 하다 + 는 편 (tendency/type) + 인 것 같다 (seems like)
Grammar Deep Dive: 게 하다 is a causative structure meaning "make/cause someone to do." 하는 편 means "the type that does" or "tends to do" - showing the speaker recognizes this as a personal pattern. This describes their unique form of empathy that involves questioning rather than just accepting.
Sentence 5
와 진짜? 진짜? 진짜로?
"Wow, really? Really? Really?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 와 - "wow" - Exclamation expressing surprise or amazement
• 진짜? - "really?" - 진짜 (really/truly) with questioning intonation
• 진짜? - "really?" - Repetition for emphasis
• 진짜로? - "really?" - 진짜 + 로 (adverb marker) with questioning tone
Grammar Deep Dive: This shows the speaker's typical response pattern - multiple repetitions of "really?" with slight variations (진짜 vs 진짜로). This demonstrates their questioning nature and how they seek deeper confirmation. The repetition mimics natural speech patterns when someone is genuinely surprised or wanting to dig deeper into someone's feelings.
Sentence 1
T 들은 그렇게 생각 안하거든요 그러니까 그게 정립이 안 되잖아
"T types don't think like that, you know. So that doesn't get established, right?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• T 들은 - "T types (topic)" - T (MBTI Thinking type) + 들 (plural) + 은 (topic particle)
• 그렇게 - "like that/in that way" - Demonstrative adverb
• 생각 안하거든요 - "don't think, you know" - 생각하다 (think) + 안 (not) + 거든요 (explanatory ending, "you know")
• 그러니까 - "so/therefore" - Conjunction showing consequence
• 그게 - "that (subject)" - 그것 + 이 contracted
• 정립이 - "establishment/organization (subject)" - 정립 (establishment/systematization) + 이 (subject)
• 안 되잖아 - "doesn't work/get done, right?" - 안 되다 (doesn't work) + 잖아 (obvious statement, seeking agreement)
Grammar Deep Dive: 거든요 is an explanatory ending that means "you know" or "because" - the speaker is explaining their understanding of T-types. 잖아 appeals to shared knowledge, assuming the listener agrees. This shows the speaker analyzing different personality approaches to emotional understanding.
Sentence 2
그 사람만의 정립이 되는 거기 때문에 어떻게 보면 감정낭비? 이렇게 돼버릴
"Because it becomes that person's own establishment, from one perspective it could end up being emotional waste?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 그 사람만의 - "that person's own" - 그 사람 (that person) + 만의 (only/exclusively belonging to)
• 정립이 되는 거기 때문에 - "because it becomes established" - 정립 + 이 되다 (becomes) + 는 것 + 이기 때문에 (because)
• 어떻게 보면 - "from one perspective/in a way" - 어떻게 (how) + 보다 (see) + 면 (if)
• 감정낭비? - "emotional waste?" - 감정 (emotion) + 낭비 (waste) with questioning intonation
• 이렇게 돼버릴 - "end up becoming like this" - 이렇게 (like this) + 되다 (become) + 버리다 (completive auxiliary) + ㄹ (future/possibility)
Grammar Deep Dive: 만의 emphasizes exclusivity - each person's individual way. 어떻게 보면 hedges the statement, showing the speaker isn't being absolute. 돼버릴 with 버리다 suggests an undesirable outcome. This analyzes how T-types might view F-type emotional processing as inefficient.
Sentence 3
T들은 그렇게 느낄 수 있는데 그렇게 느껴져요 그게 약간 ENFP의 특징인지는 모르겠는데
"T types can feel that way, and I feel that way too. I'm not sure if that's somewhat an ENFP characteristic"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• T들은 - "T types (topic)" - T + 들 (plural) + 은 (topic)
• 그렇게 느낄 수 있는데 - "can feel that way, but" - 그렇게 (that way) + 느끼다 (feel) + ㄹ 수 있다 (can) + 는데 (but)
• 그렇게 느껴져요 - "I feel that way" - 그렇게 + 느껴지다 (to be felt/seem) + 어요 (polite)
• 그게 - "that (subject)" - 그것 + 이 contracted
• 약간 - "somewhat/kind of" - Adverb meaning slightly
• ENFP의 특징인지는 - "whether it's an ENFP characteristic" - ENFP + 의 (possessive) + 특징 (characteristic) + 인지 (whether) + 는 (topic)
• 모르겠는데 - "I don't know, but" - 모르다 (not know) + 겠 (uncertainty) + 는데 (but)
Grammar Deep Dive: 느끼다 vs 느껴지다 - active feeling vs passive perception. 인지는 모르겠는데 shows uncertainty about MBTI categorization. The speaker relates to T-type thinking while questioning if this fits their supposed ENFP type, showing continued identity confusion.
Sentence 4
좀 상상력도 많고 그 얘기를 이렇게 듣고 있으면 항상 그러면 만약에 이런상황이면
"I have quite a bit of imagination too, and when I'm listening to that story like this, I always think 'then what if in a situation like this'"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 좀 - "quite/a bit" - Adverb meaning somewhat
• 상상력도 - "imagination too" - 상상력 (imagination) + 도 (also/too)
• 많고 - "have a lot and" - 많다 (many/much) + 고 (and)
• 그 얘기를 - "that story (object)" - 그 얘기 (that story) + 를 (object particle)
• 이렇게 듣고 있으면 - "when listening like this" - 이렇게 (like this) + 듣다 (listen) + 고 있다 (continuous) + 면 (when/if)
• 항상 - "always" - Adverb meaning consistently
• 그러면 - "then/in that case" - Conjunction
• 만약에 - "what if" - Conditional expression
• 이런상황이면 - "if it's a situation like this" - 이런 상황 (this kind of situation) + 이면 (if)
Grammar Deep Dive: This sentence shows the speaker's N (iNtuitive) trait - using imagination to explore hypothetical scenarios. The structure 듣고 있으면 항상 shows a habitual pattern. This demonstrates typical ENFP behavior of extrapolating from current situations to explore possibilities.
Sentence 5
넌 어떨 거 같아? 되게 질문을 많이 하는데 이거는 S 분들이
"What do you think you'd be like? I ask a lot of questions, but this is something S people"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 넌 - "you" - 너는 contracted to casual form
• 어떨 거 같아? - "what do you think you'd be like?" - 어떻다 (how/what like) + ㄹ 것 같다 (think/seem)
• 되게 - "really/very" - Casual adverb meaning quite
• 질문을 - "questions (object)" - 질문 (question) + 을 (object particle)
• 많이 하는데 - "ask a lot, but" - 많이 (a lot) + 하다 (do) + 는데 (but)
• 이거는 - "this (topic)" - 이것 + 은 contracted
• S 분들이 - "S people (subject)" - S (MBTI Sensing type) + 분들 (people, honorific) + 이 (subject)
Grammar Deep Dive: This shows the speaker's typical questioning pattern. 어떨 거 같아 is a common way to ask for someone's opinion about hypothetical situations. The sentence cuts off, suggesting the speaker is about to contrast N vs S types - how Sensing types might respond differently to imaginative questions.
Sentence 6
네 맞아요 상상을 잘 공감을 못하시더라고요 계란이랑 소세지
"Yes, that's right. They can't really empathize with imagination. Eggs and sausage"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 네 - "yes" - Affirmative response
• 맞아요 - "that's right" - 맞다 (correct) + 아요 (polite)
• 상상을 - "imagination (object)" - 상상 (imagination) + 을 (object particle)
• 잘 - "well/easily" - Adverb, here meaning "easily" or "well"
• 공감을 못하시더라고요 - "can't empathize" - 공감 (empathy) + 을 못하다 (can't do) + 시 (honorific) + 더라고요 (observed experience)
• 계란이랑 - "eggs and" - 계란 (egg) + 이랑 (and/with, casual)
• 소세지 - "sausage" - English loanword
Grammar Deep Dive: 더라고요 indicates the speaker learned this through observation - "I noticed that..." The sudden shift to "eggs and sausage" suggests a topic change, possibly someone mentioning food or the conversation being interrupted. This shows natural speech patterns where conversations can suddenly shift.
Sentence 7
마늘도 있구 김치.. 만두도 있어요 만두
"There's garlic too, kimchi... there are dumplings too. Dumplings."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 마늘도 - "garlic too" - 마늘 (garlic) + 도 (also/too)
• 있구 - "there is" - 있다 (exist/have) + 구 (casual ending, variant of 고)
• 김치.. - "kimchi.." - Traditional Korean fermented cabbage, with trailing off
• 만두도 - "dumplings too" - 만두 (dumpling) + 도 (also)
• 있어요 - "there are" - 있다 + 어요 (polite present tense)
• 만두 - "dumplings" - Repetition for emphasis or confirmation
Grammar Deep Dive: This appears to be listing food items, possibly describing what's available for a meal. The repetition of 만두 and the trailing "김치.." suggest casual, natural speech where the speaker is either looking at food or responding to someone asking about food options. 구 is a dialectal or casual variant of 고.
Sentence 8
만두도 있고
"There are dumplings too"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 만두도 - "dumplings too" - 만두 (dumpling) + 도 (also/too)
• 있고 - "there are and" - 있다 (exist/have) + 고 (and/connective)
Grammar Deep Dive: This continues the food listing pattern. The 고 ending suggests the speaker is continuing to list items or the sentence was cut off. This type of repetition and listing is common in casual Korean conversation, especially when describing available options or items.
Sentence 1
뭐야 닭가슴살 있잖아 음 닭가슴살이 몇 개 있어요
"What? There's chicken breast, you know. Hmm, how many pieces of chicken breast are there?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 뭐야 - "what?" - 뭐 (what) + 야 (casual exclamatory ending)
• 닭가슴살 - "chicken breast" - 닭 (chicken) + 가슴 (chest/breast) + 살 (meat)
• 있잖아 - "there is, you know" - 있다 (exist) + 잖아 (obvious fact, seeking agreement)
• 음 - "hmm" - Filler sound expressing thinking or consideration
• 닭가슴살이 - "chicken breast (subject)" - 닭가슴살 + 이 (subject particle)
• 몇 개 - "how many pieces" - 몇 (how many) + 개 (counter for items)
• 있어요 - "are there" - 있다 + 어요 (polite present tense)
Grammar Deep Dive: 뭐야 shows surprise or sudden realization. 있잖아 appeals to shared knowledge - "you know there is." The shift from casual (뭐야, 있잖아) to polite (있어요) shows the speaker adjusting their speech level, possibly addressing different people or becoming more formal when asking a question.
Sentence 2
계란말이 해드릴까요? 계란말이도 할 줄 아세요? 뉴욕 스타일로요?
"Shall I make rolled eggs for you? Do you know how to make rolled eggs too? New York style?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 계란말이 - "rolled eggs" - 계란 (egg) + 말이 (rolling, from 말다 to roll)
• 해드릴까요? - "shall I make for you?" - 해드리다 (do for someone, humble) + ㄹ까요 (shall I?)
• 계란말이도 - "rolled eggs too" - 계란말이 + 도 (also/too)
• 할 줄 아세요? - "do you know how to do?" - 하다 + ㄹ 줄 알다 (know how to) + 세요 (polite question)
• 뉴욕 스타일로요? - "New York style?" - 뉴욕 (New York) + 스타일 (style) + 로 (in the manner of) + 요 (polite)
Grammar Deep Dive: 해드릴까요 is humble offering - showing respect by offering to do something for someone. ㄹ 줄 알다 means "know how to do" - a fixed expression for abilities. The mention of "New York style" suggests cultural exchange or someone with international experience, showing Korean interest in foreign cooking methods.
Sentence 3
뉴욕에서도 계란말이를 먹어요? 저 뉴욕에서 거의 집에서 해먹었어요
"Do they eat rolled eggs in New York too? I mostly made and ate them at home in New York."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 뉴욕에서도 - "in New York too" - 뉴욕 + 에서 (at/in) + 도 (also/even)
• 계란말이를 - "rolled eggs (object)" - 계란말이 + 를 (object particle)
• 먹어요? - "do they eat?" - 먹다 (eat) + 어요 (polite question)
• 저 - "I (humble)" - Humble first person pronoun
• 뉴욕에서 - "in New York" - 뉴욕 + 에서 (at/in location)
• 거의 - "almost/mostly" - Adverb meaning nearly
• 집에서 - "at home" - 집 (house/home) + 에서 (at/in)
• 해먹었어요 - "made and ate" - 해먹다 (make and eat) + 었어요 (past polite)
Grammar Deep Dive: 해먹다 is a compound verb meaning "make and eat" - showing the complete process from cooking to consumption. The speaker is sharing personal experience living in New York, suggesting they're Korean but have international experience. This creates cultural bridge in the conversation.
Sentence 4
뉴욕 스타일은 좀 다를 거 같아
"New York style would probably be a bit different"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 뉴욕 스타일은 - "New York style (topic)" - 뉴욕 스타일 + 은 (topic particle)
• 좀 - "a bit/somewhat" - Adverb meaning slightly
• 다를 거 같아 - "would probably be different" - 다르다 (different) + ㄹ 것 같다 (seems like/probably)
Grammar Deep Dive: ㄹ 것 같다 expresses probability or supposition about future or unknown situations. The casual ending (같아) shows the speaker is relaxed and speculating naturally. This shows Korean awareness that cooking styles adapt to local ingredients and preferences when transplanted to other countries.
Sentence 5
오 진짜 맛있겠다
"Oh, that would be really delicious"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 오 - "oh" - Exclamation expressing interest or anticipation
• 진짜 - "really/truly" - Adverb meaning genuinely
• 맛있겠다 - "would be delicious" - 맛있다 (delicious) + 겠 (conjecture/future) + 다 (casual ending)
Grammar Deep Dive: 겠다 expresses conjecture about future taste based on current anticipation. This is a natural response when someone offers to cook something appealing. The casual, enthusiastic tone shows genuine interest in trying the New York-style cooking.
Sentence 6
음.....
"Hmm....."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 음..... - "hmm....." - Extended filler sound expressing deep thought, hesitation, or uncertainty
Grammar Deep Dive: Extended filler sounds like this show the speaker is thinking, processing, or unsure about how to proceed. The length of the "음....." suggests significant hesitation or contemplation, possibly about how to start cooking or what to do next.
Sentence 7
음..... 어떻게 하는 거지?
"Hmm..... How do you do this?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 음..... - "hmm....." - Extended thinking sound
• 어떻게 - "how" - Question word asking about method
• 하는 거지? - "do you do this?" - 하다 (do) + 는 것 (nominalizer) + 이지 (wondering/questioning to oneself)
Grammar Deep Dive: 거지 is used when wondering aloud or asking rhetorical questions, often to oneself. This suggests the speaker is looking at something (probably cooking equipment) and wondering how to operate it. The tone is one of genuine puzzlement rather than asking someone directly.
Sentence 8
이거 혹시 인덕션 하실 줄 아는 분..?
"Um, does anyone know how to use this induction cooktop..?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 이거 - "this" - Demonstrative pronoun for nearby object
• 혹시 - "by any chance/perhaps" - Adverb used when making tentative requests
• 인덕션 - "induction (cooktop)" - English loanword for induction cooking
• 하실 줄 아는 분..? - "person who knows how to use" - 하다 + 실 (honorific) + 줄 알다 (know how) + 는 분 (person) with trailing question
Grammar Deep Dive: 혹시 makes the request more polite and tentative. The trailing "분..?" with hesitation shows the speaker is looking around for help without directly imposing on anyone. This is typical Korean indirect communication style when asking for assistance.
Sentence 9
어... 이거 어떻게 켜요?
"Uh... how do you turn this on?"
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 어... - "uh..." - Hesitation sound showing uncertainty
• 이거 - "this" - Demonstrative for nearby object
• 어떻게 - "how" - Question word for method
• 켜요? - "turn on?" - 켜다 (turn on/light) + 요 (polite question)
Grammar Deep Dive: This is a direct, practical question after the previous indirect inquiry. The speaker has moved from wondering aloud to asking someone directly for help. 켜다 is used for turning on electronic devices, lights, or appliances.
Sentence 10
어? 그거는 켜는 거고? 죄송해요
"Huh? That turns it on? I'm sorry."
Detailed Word Analysis:
• 어? - "huh?" - Exclamation of surprise or realization
• 그거는 - "that (topic)" - 그것 + 은 contracted
• 켜는 거고? - "is for turning on?" - 켜다 + 는 것 (nominalizer) + 이고 (is and) with questioning tone
• 죄송해요 - "I'm sorry" - Formal polite apology
